metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4338 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wp-includes/functions.php in WordPress before 3.6.1 does not properly determine whether data has been serialized, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by triggering erroneous PHP unserialize operations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.1+dfsg-1').
